title: Optimal Control Theory
description: Optimal control theory provides mathematical methods for finding control policies that optimize a performance criterion subject to system dynamics.
learning_objectives: Understand dynamic programming and HJB equations
Apply optimal control to Active Inference

content.overview: Optimal control theory develops systematic methods for determining control policies that optimize a performance measure while satisfying system dynamics and constraints. It provides the foundation for modern control design and decision making under uncertainty.

problem_formulation.cost_functional: J = ∫_0^T L(x(t), u(t), t) dt + Φ(x(T))
problem_formulation.constraints: Initial conditions, state constraints, control bounds
problem_formulation.goal: Find control u*(t) that minimizes J

linear_quadratic_regulator.closed_loop_stability: Guaranteed stability for appropriate Q, R

dynamic_programming.optimal_policy: u*(x,t) = argmin_u H(x, ∇_x V, u, t)

connection_to_active_inference.policy_selection: Control as minimizing expected free energy
